title: onClick event is not firing after enabling button via ref
body:
<!--
  Note: if the issue is about documentation or the website, please file it at:
  https://github.com/reactjs/reactjs.org/issues/new
-->

**Do you want to request a *feature* or report a *bug*?**
possible Bug, needs investigation

**What is the current behavior?**
When having a button initially rendered disabled and with a event connected and I enable the button via ref then the event does not get fired on click.

**If the current behavior is a bug, please provide the steps to reproduce and if possible a minimal demo of the problem. Your bug will get fixed much faster if we can run your code and it doesn't have dependencies other than React. Paste the link to your JSFiddle (https://jsfiddle.net/Luktwrdm/) or CodeSandbox (https://codesandbox.io/s/new) example below:**

I have a codesandbox here https://codesandbox.io/s/l71w795xnq

Hello2 Component has the ref implementation, the Hello Component was based on State (which is working). It was used on behalf of a question on Hashnode regarding this behavior.

**What is the expected behavior?**
onClick event fires after enabling the button

**Which versions of React, and which browser / OS are affected by this issue? Did this work in previous versions of React?**

React Version is 16.3.2 in the sandbox, I do not know which version the questioner had, I'll share this issue with him. It also didnâ€™t work with refs created by callback or string.
